org.jsonurl

Interface ValueFactory<V,C extends V,ABT,A extends C,JBT,J extends C,B extends V,M extends V,N extends V,S extends V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - value type (any JSON value)
    C - composite type (array or object)
    ABT - array builder type
    A - array type
    JBT - object builder type
    J - object type
    B - boolean type
    M - number type
    N - null type
    S - string type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    JavaValueFactory, JsonOrgValueFactory, JsonpValueFactory, ValueFactory.BigMathFactory<V,C,ABT,A,JBT,J,B,M,N,S>, ValueFactory.TransparentBuilder<V,C,A,J,B,M,N,S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaValueFactory.BigMathFactory, JsonOrgValueFactory.BigMathFactory, JsonpValueFactory.BigDecimalFactory, JsonpValueFactory.BigMathFactory

    public interface ValueFactory<V,C extends V,ABT,A extends C,JBT,J extends C,B extends V,M extends V,N extends V,S extends V>
    A ValueFactory allows Parser to be implementation independent. It abstracts the classes, interfaces, and values specific to each implementation (json.org, JSR-374, etc).
    Since:
    2019-09-01
    Author:
    jsonurl.org, David MacCormack

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ValueFactory.BigMathFactory<V,C extends V,ABT,A extends C,JBT,J extends C,B extends V,M extends V,N extends V,S extends V>
      A ValueFactory that also implements the BigMathProvider interface.
      static interface  ValueFactory.TransparentBuilder<V,C extends V,A extends C,J extends C,B extends V,M extends V,N extends V,S extends V>
      A ValueFactory with transparent array and object builders.

    • Method Detail

      • getEmptyComposite

        C getEmptyComposite()
        get the empty composite value.

        This is usually a singleton. It's a value which represents the empty composite (i.e. array/object) as defined in the JSON→URL spec.

        Returns:
        a valid composite instance

      • newArray

        A newArray(ABT builder)
        construct a new JSON array from the given builder.

        Some implementations implement the builder pattern and separate arrays from things that build arrays. This method accepts an array builder and returns an array. For implementations that do not separate arrays from builders this may be the identity function.

        Parameters:
        builder - an array builder
        Returns:
        a valid JSON array

      • newObject

        J newObject(JBT builder)
        construct a new JSON object from the given builder.

        Some implementations implement the builder pattern and separate objects from things that build objects. This method accepts an object builder and returns an object. For implementations that do not separate objects from builders this may be the identity function.

        Parameters:
        builder - an object builder
        Returns:
        a valid JSON object

      • newArrayBuilder

        ABT newArrayBuilder()
        get a new JSON array builder.

        Some implementations implement the builder pattern and separate objects from things that build objects. This method must return a new JSON array builder.

        Returns:
        a valid JSON array builder

      • newObjectBuilder

        JBT newObjectBuilder()
        get a new JSON object builder.

        Some implementations implement the builder pattern and separate objects from things that build objects. This method must return a new JSON object builder.

        Returns:
        a valid JSON object builder

        void add(ABT dest,
         V obj)
        add a value to an array.

      • put

        void put(JBT dest,
         String key,
         V value)
        add a key/value pair to an object.

      • getNull

        N getNull()
        get the null value.

        This is usually a singleton. It's a Java Object which represents the JSON value null.

        Returns:
        a valid null instance

      • getTrue

        B getTrue()
        get the true value.

        This is usually a singleton. It's a Java Object which represents the JSON boolean value true.

        Returns:
        the JSON value true

      • getFalse

        B getFalse()
        get the true value.

        This is usually a singleton. It's a Java Object which represents the JSON boolean value false.

        Returns:
        the JSON value false

        M getNumber(NumberText text)
        Get a number value for the given parsed text.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a number object for the given text

      • getBoolean

        default B getBoolean(boolean value)
        Get a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        value - a boolean value
        Returns:
        if b is true then return true; otherwise, return false.

      • isValid

        default boolean isValid(ValueType type,
                        V value)
        Test if the given value has the given type. This simply calls isValid(EnumSet.of(type), value).
        Parameters:
        type - allowed type
        value - value to test

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(Set<ValueType> types,
                V value)
        Test if the type of the given value is present in types.
        Parameters:
        types - set of allowed types
        value - value to test
        Returns:
        true if the type of value is in the given types set.

      • isEmptyComposite

        default boolean isEmptyComposite(Object obj)
        Test if the given object is the empty composite value.
        Parameters:
        obj - a Java Object
        Returns:
        true if obj is the empty composite; false otherwise.

      • isNull

        default boolean isNull(Object obj)
        Test if the given object is the null value.
        Parameters:
        obj - a Java Object
        Returns:
        true if obj is the null value; false otherwise.

                           int start,

        get a true, false, or null value for the given text.
        Parameters:
